title: Thunderbird
content: I have used Thunderbird for many years without a issue. But as of a couple days ago I have been getting errors when I open Thunderbird. 1) It always ask me to login even after I save the password to always login. 2) I get this message: "Login to server imap.comcast.net with username caulkerguy@comcast.net failed." 3) Then I get this error message "Alert from account caulkerguy@comcast.net 1014." I have checked all my Server settings and all are correct as per your online settings. I have searched the web and have not found any fixes. Are there any fixes or work arounds? I would hate to stop using Thunderbird as I really like it! I have included 2 screenshots.Thanks for any and all help! Mike: caulkerguy@comcast.net or caulkerguy@gmail.com
creator: caulkerguy1

title: junk mail
content: All my emails are going into the junk folder, HELP!!
creator: phatyoda

title: Multiple password request popups
content: There is an account in my Thunderbird settings for which I have forgotten the Password, and a popup informs me of this. However when I click Cancel, the popup pops up again and again every minute or two, till if if left alone, the plethora of popups fills the screen. How can I make it request the password only once, and not keep opening popups? It may be some days before I can retrieve the password.
creator: dwmusic

title: Loss of emails. folders, accounts etc after an unrequested Thunderbird update.
content: A while ago I had an unwanted update of Thunderbird, and lost emails and local folders, some of which were very important. Can you please advise how I can recover them. Regards Colin.
creator: colink1946

title: Contact sidebar shrunk in height
content:
I was upgraded to TB 115 when I had to get a new computer. I have become quite used to using userchrome to highly personalise my TB, mainly to restore previous features.

However, somehow, in making the "Write" screen the way I like it, I have shrunk the section of the Contacts Sidebar which contains the actual addresses/contacts, down to the point where only one contact is visible. There is a scroll bar so I can see the other addresses are there. It is just that the bottom border of that box has elevated itself and there is a mass of blank space below.

I am sure I have caused it with some code, however everything I have tried to adjust only works on the heading part of the Contacts Sidebar, not the panel with the addresses. I have searched the net to find out what that panel is officially called, without success.

Could a helpful person tell me the "official" name (to use in the css) of that panel so that I can fix it? Or even write me a little code to make that box go back to default?

Just for context, the reason I was fiddling with it was because the panel is excessively spaced, and I was trying to compact the contacts together.

Thanks Fiona
creator: pandf

title: Downloading email messages
content: My Thunderbird is continually downloading email messages, severely affecting its functionality, making it unusable. How can I reset it.
creator: timjepson

title: i lost my archief map in mail mailaccount
content: I lost my archief map in my mail
creator: janzuidersma

title: No support of 64bit PKCS#11 drivers for signing device (i.e. smart cards) on 64bit Thunderbird
content:
Hi, I have a 115.6.1 (64-bit) version of Mozilla Thunderbird, and yet the device manager does not accept 64bit PKCS11 drivers (from C:\Windows\SysWOW64) for smart cards (tried several smart cards). It only accepts 32bit drivers. I have a smart card which does not have a 32bit PKCS11 driver.

Does anyone know why a 64bit version of thunderbird does not support 64bit PKCS11 drivers? Would any of the developers be able to address this please?

Thank you.
creator: kralpatr

title: emails being sent as plain/text only
content:
I have 'Compose messages in HTML format' set in 'Composition & Addressing' but over last couple of weeks outgoing emails have been sent as plain/text only (not multipart with html part). If I include an image - then they are sent multipart (as have to!) text/plain text/html image/jpeg.

I'm on 115.6.0 (64-bit) on Ubuntu 22.04.03

I can't see other recent reports of this issue - any thoughts?
creator: jon109

title: Threading / Unthreading
content:
Hello. As I see from other discussions topics, threaded folders are NOT popular. PLEASE can you offer an option, across the whole of Thunderbird, for NOT having emails threaded. Thuis INCLUDES, when using the Search features, where the reults appear as threaded, which is counter intuitive when searching for one particular message.

THanks David SELIG (faithful user)
creator: davidselig

title: Dragging message to a different folder doesn't highlight the drop folder
content:
When dragging an email to a different folder....

Prior versions of Thunderbird would highlight the folder you are dragging to, which helps you to be sure it will go into the correct folder. Supernova does not highlight the folder where the emails will be dropped. It moves the message just fine, however...unable to be sure that message is dropped in the correct place.

According to an old forum, this was an issue 13 years ago as well.

Thanks!
creator: barnboy

title: How long for a response to a bug report?
content: A week ago I reported a bug in 115, https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1875103 , which forced me back to 102. This is so far untriaged. Can anyone say roughly how long it will be before this is picked up by the dev team for review? Thanks
creator: cjg.aptl

title: Proteção de Senha Salva
content:
Olá a todos, estou avaliando a utilização do Thunderbird nos computadores da empresa, instalei primeiramente no meu pc e estou em duvida quando a proteção de senha.

Ao configurar a caixa de email, observei que a senha de acesso ao email fica salva em senhas memorizadas, o que não poderia acontecer pois o funcionário poderia ter acesso a senha do email. Pesquisei e achei a opção de colocar uma senha mestre ou senha principal, mas neste caso toda vez que o funcionario for abir a caixa de email , vai solicitar a senha meste/principal para ele poder trabalhar, e junto com isso ter acesso novamente as senhas memorizadas.

Alguém sabe se existe uma forma de não deixar a senha memorizada exposta ? Tem alguma forma para resolver essa situação ?

Desde já agradeço a atenção !

Obrigado.
creator: healthrootsbr
